title: Colorado HHS response

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Colorado HHS response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Colorado Department of Human Services remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any Colorado Department of Human Services employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of March 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of March 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eva Tang

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request #25-2869
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for furnishing the documents given so far.

On December 14, 2025, I received a communication from the City stating, "Lastly, we will not be providing records related to queries made by outside agencies using our data. For information regarding inquiries conducted by other agencies, we respectfully direct you to submit a request to those agencies directly. "

However, MVPD's policy manual section 460.9 states a few things: Outside agencies make written requests for ALPR data including their agency's name, the name of the person requesting, and the intended purpose of obtaining that information, the request must be reviewed by the Special Operations Division Captain or authorized designee, and then the request is retained on file. Given that these requests are retained on file by MVPD and are not subject to any exemptions from the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), MVPD is responsible for releasing them to requestors as per the FOIA. Please provide the responsive materials forthwith.

Respectfully,
Eva Tang

title: Department of Defense support for Tyler Rich music video "Give Up to Get It"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for Tyler Rich music video "Give Up to Get It"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the 2024 Tyler Rich music video "Give Up to Get It." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Give Up to Get It," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

This music video appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: MPIA Request for IAD Records

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: MPIA Request for IAD Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I am hereby requesting access to the records listed below and held by the Baltimore Police Department:

- Copies of any and all closed and pending internal affairs complaints, including internal, citizen, or other agency complaints of the following officers:

1. Paul St Surin
2. Kristopher Bielecki
3. Jairo Palacios
4. Tony Tiburzi
5. Troy Horton-Jones
6. David Weldon
7. Mamadou Bah
8. Nevin Nolte
9. Matthew Banocy
10. Morgan Banocy
11. Zachary Ruhling
12. Walter Holleman
13. Cole Hofmann
14. William Healey
15. Tyler Coss Y Leon

- Complete investigative files for each complaint, including but not limited to reports of recorded statements, video surveillance or body camera footage, investigative files, witness interviews, and photographs.
- The investigative findings of each complaint.
- Any correspondence from the Civilian Review Board, Police Accountability Board, Administrative Charging Committee or other civilian police oversight board.
- The final disposition of each case, if any.

****As with previous requests of this nature,  we will accept disciplinary history summaries -- to include ALL closed and pending complaints -- for all of the officers listed for the time being.****

The Maryland Public Information Act requires that the requested information be forwarded within ten (10) days. Pursuant to General Provisions § 4-203(b)(2), if it will take more than 10 working days to produce the requested records, we must be notified, in writing or by email, of that fact. If the records are not able to be produced within 10 days, you may request an extension up to thirty (30) days.  If access to any or all records described above is denied, please identify in a written statement the general content of each item being withheld. Additionally, § 4-203 (a) and (c) of the General Provisions Article requires you to provide in writing grounds for denial, citing legal authority under which you may deny access.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.  Alternatively, please consider waiving any fees, pursuant to § 4-206(e)(2)(ii) of the General Provisions Article, as this request is on behalf of individuals served by the Maryland Office of the Public Defender, a state government agency, which solely serves indigent citizens of Maryland.  As a result, my request for the above-listed public records is in the public interest.  I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Deborah Levi
Director of Special Litigation
Maryland Office of the Public Defender
(443) 272-1068

Your request is assigned to Nicola Gills who can be contacted directly at Nicola.Gills@baltimorepolice.org<mailto:Brooke.Nice2@baltimorepolice.org>. Officer K. Rose

If you are not the intended recipient, or the employee or agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended recipient, you are notified that any distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the Legal Affairs Division immediately by telephone at 410-396-2496 and DELETE the message from your system immediately.

The materials in this e-mail are private and may contain sensitive law enforcement information. Please note that e-mail is not necessarily confidential or secure. Use of e-mail constitutes your acknowledgment of these confidentiality and security limitations. If you are not the intended recipient, be advised that any unauthorized use, disclosure, copying, distribution, or the taking of any action in reliance on the contents of this information is strictly prohibited as covered by the Electronic Communications Privacy Act, 18 U.S.C. §§ 2510-2521. If you have received this e-mail in error, please immediately notify the sender via telephone or return e-mail.

title: Department of Defense support for TV documentary series "Expedition Unknown"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for TV documentary series "Expedition Unknown"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the TV documentary series "Expedition Unknown" (2015-2024), hosted by Josh Gates. Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Expedition Unknown," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

"Expedition Unknown" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Cherokee County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Cherokee County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Open Records Request: Grant Application Materials BJA FY 23 Preventing School Violence: BJA’s STOP School Violence Program (O-BJA-2023-171666). (Department of Justice, Bureau of Justice Assistance)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Open Records Request: Grant Application Materials BJA FY 23 Preventing School Violence: BJA’s STOP School Violence Program (O-BJA-2023-171666). (Department of Justice, Bureau of Justice Assistance)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All grant application materials and notice of award letters from successful awardees that applied to the Department of Justice's (DOJ) March 15, 2023 solicitation for the BJA FY 23 Preventing School Violence: BJA’s STOP School Violence Program (O-BJA-2023-171666). 

"Grant application materials" include, but are not limited to, Federal Assistance standard form (SF-424), Disclosure of Lobbying Activities (SF-LLL), and the "full application, including attachments, in JustGrants." It also includes the grantee's "proposal abstract," "proposal narrative," "goals, objectives, and deliverables," "budget and associated documents,""budget worksheet and budget narrative," "questionnaire," "memoranda of understanding and other supportive documents," "additional application components," "Timeline Form," "Letters of Support," and "Research and Evaluation."

I request all responsive records regardless of format, medium, or physical characteristics. Electronic records should be produced in their unlocked native format with all original metadata and original filenames. Paper documents should be scanned and produced as Adobe PDF files or TIF files. Emails produced should be grouped together with any attachments. When searching emails, please search all folders, including inbox, subject matter folders, sent items, archived items, and deleted items. Please produce all metadata fields for emails, including BCC.
For responsive records, I request that you provide individual computer records or scanned documents in a searchable format, such as Microsoft Word or searchable Adobe Acrobat pdf, and any data and statistical information, if applicable, in a format that is searchable and analyzable, such as a .txt or .csv file or a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Clarence Okoh

title: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Fremont County Clerk & Recorder's Office)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Fremont County Clerk & Recorder's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: VA - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VA - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am a researcher interested in fishing and hunting license prices. I would like to obtain annual data on the yearly recreational fishing and hunting license and tag price data from 1990 to present. Specifically, I would like records showing the fees for the following licenses and tags for both residents and nonresidents (where applicable) from 1/1/1990 to 1/12/26 (listed annually, i.e., one fee per license/tag per year from 1990 to 2026). Please also include the agent fee, where applicable. Please provide fees pertaining to adults only (16-64). In cases of reciprocal pricing agreements with other states, please provide both the special reciprocal prices to residents of those states and the general price to residents of all states without a reciprocal pricing agreement, where necessary.

Resident Hunting License (age 16 and older) - 1 year only
Resident Bear License
Resident Deer/Turkey License
Resident Fox Hunting License
Nonresident Hunting License
Nonresident 3-Day Hunt License
Nonresident Fox Hunting License
Nonresident Bear License
Nonresident Deer/Turkey License 

Resident State Freshwater Fishing License - 1 year only
Resident State Fresh/Saltwater Fishing
Resident Saltwater Fishing License
Resident 5-Day Freshwater Fishing
Resident 10-Day Saltwater Fishing
Resident Trout Fishing
Nonresident State Freshwater Fishing (age 16 or older)
Nonresident Saltwater Fishing License
Nonresident State Fresh/Saltwater Fishing
Nonresident 1-Day Freshwater Fishing
Nonresident 5-Day Freshwater Fishing
Nonresident 10-Day Saltwater Fishing License
Nonresident 5-Day Fresh/Saltwater Fishing
Nonresident Trout Fishing

If data is not available back to 1990 for one or more of the specified license or tag prices, please provide data from the oldest year on record to present. To what extent license or tag names might have changed, please match to the most similar license or tag, if possible, for continuation purposes. If possible, please provide the data in a table. Thank you for your help.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Christian Hachtman.

title: Department of Defense support for TV documentary series "The NFL's Most Interesting Jobs"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for TV documentary series "The NFL's Most Interesting Jobs"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the TV documentary series "The NFL's Most Interesting Jobs" (2022-), featuring Steve Smith, Sr. Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The NFL's Most Interesting Jobs," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

"The NFL's Most Interesting Jobs" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Good morning,



I am the Action Officer for this case. This email is in response to your 
status update request regarding OSD/JS FOIA 25-F-4000 (attached for your 
convenience).

It is our policy that each request receives prompt attention, and every effort 
is made to treat all requesters equally.  Please note that your request was 
tasked for search.  Unfortunately, the search for the requested records has 
not been completed.  As stated in our interim response, our administrative 
workload was 3,395 open requests at the time we received this request. Once I 
receive the response from the component conducting the search, I will act on 
your request as soon as possible and respond directly to you. The component 
office conducting the search has provided me with an anticipated date of 6 
months from now for completion of their search.  I apologize for the 
anticipated delay in responding to your request.

If you have any additional questions, please contact me.

Chris Greene

title: dei books

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: dei books
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to curricula and book challenges: 

https://www.newsday.com/long-island/education/eastport-south-manor-books-obsolete-i4izh29t

Therefore, I request the following: 

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to “obsolete”and “resolution”; “surplus”, “disposal”, “weeding log”, “deselection”, “purchase order”, “replacement”, or “damaged books”. 

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning “farenheit 451”, “the bluest eye”, “black boy”, “inherit the wind”, “to kill a mockingbird”, “the hate u give’, “go ask alice”, “lgbtq”, “joseph steimel”, “curriculum” and “2025-2026”; or “dei”.

3) Any emails, presentations, videos, memos, recordings, or other records mentioning  “farenheit 451”, “the bluest eye”, “black boy”, “inherit the wind”, “to kill a mockingbird”, “the hate u give’, “go ask alice”, “lgbtq”, “joseph steimel”, “curriculum” and “2025-2026”; “obsolete”and “resolution”; “surplus”, “disposal”, “weeding log”, “deselection”, “purchase order”, “replacement”, “damaged books” or “dei”.

Please perform this search for records between June 1, 2025 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Claire Woodcock

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: dei books
communications.communication:
Hi-- to clarify, I'm interested in documents related to book bans that include any of the keywords below. For instance, I'm not interested in items unrelated to "dei" that aren't also related to book bans. Let m know if you seek further clarification.

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to curricula and book challenges:

https://www.newsday.com/long-island/education/eastport-south-manor-books-obsolete-i4izh29t

Therefore, I request the following:

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to “obsolete”, “surplus”, “disposal”, “weeding log”, “deselection”, “purchase order”, “replacement”, or “damaged books”.

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning “farenheit 451”, “the bluest eye”, “black boy”, “inherit the wind”, “to kill a mockingbird”, “the hate u give’, “go ask alice”, “lgbtq”, or “dei”.

3) Any emails, presentations, videos, memos, recordings, or other records mentioning “farenheit 451”, “the bluest eye”, “black boy”, “inherit the wind”, “to kill a mockingbird”, “the hate u give’, “go ask alice”, “lgbtq”, “obsolete”and “resolution”; “surplus”, “disposal”, “weeding log”, “deselection”, “purchase order”, “replacement”, “damaged books” or “dei”.

Please perform this search for records between June 1, 2025 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

title: West Virginia HHS response

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia HHS response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Re: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia HHS response
communications.communication:
Due to the passage of HB 2006 during the 2023 Legislative session, and Governor Jim Justice signing the bill into law on March 4, 2023, the WV Dept. of Health and Human Resources was divided into three separate departments effective January 1, 2024, the Department of Health (DH), Department of Health Facilities (DHF) and Department of Human Services (DoHS).  

You have reached the Department of Human Services. If you are requesting public records maintained by this Department, a formal response will be forthcoming. If your request involves the Department of Health, your requests can be sent to DHFOIA@wv.gov, or if it is for the Department of Health Facilities, you requests can be sent to DHFFOIA@wv.gov.

Please be advised that this inbox does not serve as a clearinghouse for all public records maintained by government entities in West Virginia. 

If you have submitted a request for records that are outside our scope of authority to the Department of Human Services, you will receive no further communication from DoHSFOIA@wv.gov.

Sincerely,

title: UAS Deployments 2025 (King County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: UAS Deployments 2025 (King County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Mission documentation of each UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System, also known as "drone") deployment in 2025, sufficient to determine the date, time, location, and purpose of each deployment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Within five (5) business days (excluding holidays) after receiving your request, we will: 
 
 
  * Provide the record(s); 
  * Or Acknowledge your request and give you a reasonable estimate of how long it will take to respond; 
  * Or Deny the request in writing, stating the reasons for the denial (this could also include a denial of part of your request and a granting of the remainder). 
The day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days. Weekends and holidays observed by the agency are also excluded in the calculation. 
 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Mission documentation of each UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System, also known as "drone") deployment in 2025, sufficient to determine the date, time, location, and purpose of each deployment.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2170454/ 
 REQUESTS FOR PRIVILEGED INFORMATION: In order to avoid unnecessary redactions and expedite production of records, please upload a scanned copy of your government-issued identification to the Attachments field of this request. If you have any questions or require assistance, please contact the KCSO Public Disclosure Unit at KCSODisclosure@kingcounty.gov or by calling 206-263-2103. 
 
Once the records have been collected, we will notify you of any applicable charges. To learn more about our fees, click HERE and then select . Any records or portion of records that are exempt from disclosure will be withheld or redacted. We will specify the exemption that applies to any documents withheld or redactions made. "What is the cost to obtain records" 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the King County Sheriff’s Office online request system. 
 
 
Public Disclosure Unit | Records Services Section

We are interpreting your request as for the drone report for KCSO between the dates of 1/1/202 and 12/31/2025.  Please advise by 2/9/2026 if this interpretation is incorrect.  If we do not hear from you by that date, we will proceed with that interpretation only.  We anticipate providing the first installment of records to you on or before 05/04/2026. If we are unable to meet this self-imposed disclosure date, we will let you know. If we are able to provide a response sooner, we will certainly do so. Please visit our website  and select "What is the cost to obtain records" for more information. Once we have determined the scope of your request and responsive records, we may provide an estimate for fees requiring 10% down prior to processing your request. title: Verra Violations (Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Verra Violations (Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2025, please provide records, by month, for the number of violations forwarded by Verra for law enforcement review, and the number of violations disapproved by law enforcement, and the total monthly law enforcement approval rate of violations transmitted by Verra for law enforcement review

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jon Smith

RE: FOIL Request of December 23, 2025, Reference # F000807-122325. 
Dear Jon Smith, 
Onondaga County received a public information request from you on December 23, 2025. Your request mentioned: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

Since January 1, 2025, please provide records, by month, for the number of violations forwarded by Verra for law enforcement review, and the number of violations disapproved by law enforcement, and the total monthly law enforcement approval rate of violations transmitted by Verra for law enforcement review 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Jon Smith 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2161273/” 
Onondaga County has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the FOIL Records Center at the following link to retrieve the appropriate responsive documents. 
FOIL Request - F000807-122325 
Sincerely, 
Isabelle Harris , Chief of Staff & FOIL Records Access Officer 
By: Judy Fougnier, Assistant FOIL RAQ CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  This e-mail is intended only for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential information belonging to the sender which is protected by the attorney-client privilege, caseworker-client privilege or other statutory prohibition against disclosure.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution or taking of any action in reliance on the contents of this information is strictly prohibited.  If you have received this e-mail in error, please immediately notify us by telephone to arrange for the return of the document.

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Santa Cruz County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Santa Cruz County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: FOIA Records Request :: W060687-012826
communications.communication:
Dear Samuel : 

Thank you for your interest in public records of Ingham County. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 1/28/2026 and given the reference number W060687-012826 for tracking purposes. 

Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Samuel Sinyangwe 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2201927/ 

Your request will be forwarded to the relevant County department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the costs, if any, associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted when we determine if the records you requested are available and if there is a cost for you to obtain the records you requested. 
PLEASE NOTE: The Michigan Freedom of Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information or answer questions. 

You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 

Again, thank you for using the FOIA Records Center. 

Ingham County

RE: FOIA REQUEST of January 28, 2026, Reference # W060687-012826 
Dear Samuel : 
This letter is in response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request referenced above.  Your request mentioned: "Sheriff's Office - To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Samuel Sinyangwe 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2201927/" 
We are extending the date to respond to your FOIA request for no more than 10 business days, until 02/20/2026. Only one extension may be taken per FOIA request. If you have any questions regarding this extension, contact Hattie Welling at 517 676-8220. Estimated Time Frame to Provide Records: 02/20/2026 
The time frame estimate is nonbinding upon the County, but the County is providing the estimate in good faith. Providing an estimated time frame does not relieve a public body from any of the other requirements of this act. Reason for Extension: need time to locate record(s) and check on status. 
The County's FOIA Procedures and Guidelines, and its Public Summary, can be found at www.ingham.org. 
Sincerely, 
Hattie Welling 
FOIA Coordinator 
Sheriff's Office

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sullivan County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sullivan County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe.

title: NC - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees (North Carolina Wildlife Resources Commission)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: NC - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees (North Carolina Wildlife Resources Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am a researcher interested in fishing and hunting license prices. I would like to obtain annual data on the yearly recreational fishing and hunting license and tag price data from 1990 to present. Specifically, I would like records showing the fees for the following licenses and tags for both residents and nonresidents (where applicable) from 1/1/1990 to 1/12/26 (listed annually, i.e., one fee per license/tag per year from 1990 to 2026). Please also include the agent fee, where applicable. Please provide fees pertaining to adults. In cases of reciprocal pricing agreements with other states, please provide both the special reciprocal prices to residents of those states and the general price to residents of all states without a reciprocal pricing agreement, where necessary.

Department of Environmental Quality - Coastal Fishing
Coastal Recreational Fishing License (Adult) 
Unified Inland/Coastal Recreational Fishing License
Coastal Recreational Fishing Ten-day

Wildlife Resources Commission 
Inland Fishing­ 10-Day
State Inland Fishing
State Hunting 10 Day
State Hunting Annual
Big Game Hunting
Big Game Hunting­ 10-Day
Bear Management E-Stamp
Bear Hunting License (nonresident

If data is not available back to 1990 for one or more of the specified license or tag prices, please provide data from the oldest year on record to present. To what extent license or tag names might have changed, please match to the most similar license or tag, if possible, for continuation purposes. If possible, please provide the data in a table. Thank you for your help.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Christian Hachtman

communications.subject: Hunting and fishing licenses
communications.communication:
Hi,

Attached should be a spreadsheet that provides the data that you requested.

I tried to include the various licenses and permits that fell within your parameters.

Since the prices didn't change much over the years, instead of providing a year-by-year price for each, I gave the price and then the year that price ended. For example, $40.00, 2014; which would mean that that license would cost $40 from whatever the first date that I have recorded until the 2014, that license was $40. If the Year End column shows 9999, then that was the last, or current price, that we have.

There is also Last Year Sold and a First Year Recorded columns, since some of these licenses are no longer available, this should help you with the ranges of prices.

The Old Fee listed is the fee that was charged until 7/1/2023. This is when we  switched over to a hosting contractor. Some licenses didn't have a fee. The New Fee started on 7/1/2023. I don't know how you wanted to break the data down, but for the new fee there is the fee that the agent makes and a transaction fee associated with the license / permit. If the selling agent is WRC or the hosting contractor, then the agent gets $3 and the transaction fee is $2. If it is any other agent, then the agent gets $4 and the transaction fee is $1.

There is a separate tab for the reciprocal pricing. Any state that isn't listed on that tab pays the same amount as the NC fee.

I hope this satisfies your request. If there is anything you need clarified or changed, please let me know.

title: Department of Defense support for TV documentary series "How Did They Fix That?"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for TV documentary series "How Did They Fix That?"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of Season 4 of the TV documentary series "How Did They Fix That?" (2024-2025). Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "How Did They Fix That?," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

Season 4 of "How Did They Fix That?" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: FOIA Request: Flock

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: FOIA Request: Flock
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Flock Safety or Flock Group that were active any time between 1/1/2020 and 12/07/2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days for records more than 24-months-old, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

m

title: Use of force data (2017-2024) (Bellevue Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Use of force data (2017-2024) (Bellevue Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P004584-073025
communications.communication:
Dear Samuel Sinyangwe, 
 
Thank you for submitting your request for public records to the City of Bellevue Police Department. Your request was received in our office on 7/30/2025 7:26:52 PM and given the reference number P004584-073025 for tracking purposes. The details of your request are below.  
 
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellevue-police-department-816%252Fuse-of-force-data-2017-2024-bellevue-police-department-190352%252F%253Femail%253DBPDrecords%252540bellevuewa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAkAtzcGNrnhGpVWwBfWPi9foI%3A1uhIz9%3AMhEpSOgZOiXaIpFsoY0m7uBjXZHF7JUZ7j1BlfCKvLs 
The City must provide a preliminary response to your request within five (5) business days (RCW 42.56.520); the day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days. Weekends and holidays observed by the City are also excluded in the calculation. For additional information regarding our response options, please click here: Prompt Response Required. The City of Bellevue has adopted a  Public Records Fee Schedule, please review it for information associated with fees that may be assessed pursuant to your request. 
You may monitor the progress of your request via the link below; you will receive an email when your request has been completed. We thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Bellevue Police Department

08/07/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
I am writing to update you on the status of your public disclosure request for Bellevue Police Department crime statistics as stated in your original request. 
Your request is still considered open and has been forwarded to the responsible department for handling. You should anticipate an additional response from our office by the end of business on 8/28/2025, if not sooner.

Jessica Havens 
Bellevue Police Department

08/22/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
The Bellevue Police Department has received your public records request for the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Samuel Sinyangwe 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellevue-police-department-816%252Fuse-of-force-data-2017-2024-bellevue-police-department-190352%252F%253Femail%253DBPDrecords%252540bellevuewa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAkAtzcGNrnhGpVWwBfWPi9foI%3A1uhIz9%3AMhEpSOgZOiXaIpFsoY0m7uBjXZHF7JUZ7j1BlfCKvLs 

The 1st installment of records responsive to your request are now available via the City of Bellevue Public Records Portal webpage.  Please note that pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download . Your request is being handled on an installment basis and we predictyour next installment to be ready on or before 10/03/2025. Please be advised, the last part of the use of force data report contains juvenile information, which will need to be redacted. While we expect to be able to provide it in October, there are thousands of lines of data within the report and each case will need to be reviewed in order for us to determine which pieces of information fall under juvenile exemptions, so we may need more time. We will provide another estimated response date by 10/03/25 if we require more time. 
Pursuant to the Public Records Act RCW 42.56, responsive records may be redacted or exempt. Please review the accompanying privilege log for further information, if such redactions or exemptions have been applied. Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requestor fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. 
If you believe the information furnished has been incorrectly redacted or is incomplete, please reach out to the assigned staff by replying to this message. Please be advised that upon closure of your request, you may file a written appeal. The appeal must include your name and address, a copy of the redacted document and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. Please mail your appeal to: 
Bellevue Police Department 
Attn: Records Supervisor 
P.O. Box 90012 
Bellevue, WA  98009-9012 
Thank you, 
Jessica Abbott 
Bellevue Police Department RPC 4.4 Inadvertent Disclosure Notification: CR 26 (b) (6) Claw Back Provision *** Please read this notice carefully *** 
Dear legal practitioner: Please take notice that we take reasonable precautions to prevent the disclosure of privileged or confidential materials, including those protected by the attorney-client privilege and/or work product doctrine, when responding to request for records.  These precautions include, but are not limited to, carefully locating and assembling responsive records, performing an intra-departmental review of the records for purposes of determining whether they contain any privileged or confidential materials, forwarding the records to the County Prosecuting Attorney's Office for independent legal review, meeting and conferring with the Prosecuting Attorney's Office to compare and reconcile any conflicting results of our separate independent reviews and, if necessary, creating a withholding log.  Despite our having taken these precautions, occasionally a mistake is made and privileged or confidential documents are inadvertently produced.  To that end, we wanted to notify you that there is a possibility that the records being produced may contain privileged or confidential materials.  The inadvertent or unintentional production of privileged or confidential documents, without a privileged or confidentiality designation should not be considered a waiver in whole or in part of any claim of privileged or confidential treatment, and any document that initially is produced without bearing a privileged or confidentiality designation may later be so designated.  In the event that you believe you have received privileged or confidential materials, we would ask that you promptly notify us of this fact and take action as necessary to comply with the obligations set forth in Rule of Professional Conduct 4.4 and/or Civil Rule 26 (b)(6).

09/30/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
Your request is still considered open. We anticipated being able to provide you with responsive records by the end of business on 10/03/2025, but the report we are reviewing for juvenile exemptions (mostly under RCW 13.50) is over 100 pages long and we need to review each case to confirm that the subject of the report was a juvenile at the time and determine if the location of the incident is protected information (e.g., if it was also their residence). We estimate that the next installment will be ready by 12/08/2025, but you can expect an additional response by the end of business on 11/7/2025, if not sooner. 
If you have any questions regarding your disclosure request or any other matter, please contact the Bellevue Police Department Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917. 
Thank you for your patience, 
Jessica Abbott 
Bellevue Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P004584-073025
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line. Anything below will not be viewable to staff. --- 

11/05/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
The Bellevue Police Department has received your public records request for the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Samuel Sinyangwe 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellevue-police-department-816%252Fuse-of-force-data-2017-2024-bellevue-police-department-190352%252F%253Femail%253DBPDrecords%252540bellevuewa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAkAtzcGNrnhGpVWwBfWPi9foI%3A1uhIz9%3AMhEpSOgZOiXaIpFsoY0m7uBjXZHF7JUZ7j1BlfCKvLs 

The 2nd installment of records responsive to your request are now available via the City of Bellevue Public Records Portal webpage.  Please note that pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download . Your request is being handled on an installment basis and we predictyour next installment to be ready on or before 12/19/2025. 
This report has been broken up into multiple PDFs since redactions of juvenile information are required (see page numbers in the document titles) in order to provide you with records, instead of finishing all redactions first. 
Pursuant to the Public Records Act RCW 42.56, responsive records may be redacted or exempt. Please review the accompanying privilege log for further information, if such redactions or exemptions have been applied. Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requestor fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. 
If you believe the information furnished has been incorrectly redacted or is incomplete, please reach out to the assigned staff by replying to this message. Please be advised that upon closure of your request, you may file a written appeal. The appeal must include your name and address, a copy of the redacted document and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. Please mail your appeal to: 
Bellevue Police Department 
Attn: Records Supervisor 
P.O. Box 90012 
Bellevue, WA  98009-9012 
Thank you, 
Jessica Abbott

02/10/2026 P004584-073025 Samuel Sinyangwe, 
The final installment of records responsive to your request are now available via the City of Bellevue Public Records Portal website. Pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download. This concludes our search of records in the custody of the Bellevue Police Department. This is our final, definitive response and your request is closed.  As the city does not intend to further address the request, the Public Records Act one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has now started to run. Pursuant to the Public Records Act RCW 42.56, responsive records may be redacted or exempt. Please review the accompanying privilege log for further information, if such redactions or exemptions have been applied. Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requestor fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. Please be advised, you may file a written appeal if you believe information has been incorrectly redacted or records have been incorrectly withheld. The appeal must include your name and address, a copy of the redacted document and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. Please mail your appeal to: Bellevue Police Department 
Attn: Records Supervisor 
P.O. Box 90012 
Bellevue, WA  98009-9012 If you require any further assistance from the Bellevue Police Department regarding this matter or have questions, please contact the Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917 within 30 days of this notification. Thank you, Jessica Abbott 
Bellevue Police Department

communications.subject: 19-47 Response to Records Request
communications.communication:
Rebecca,

This is notice to you that the time to provide a response to your public records request dated 1/8/19, is extended to no later than 1/31/19, pursuant to Government Code section 6253(c), due to the need to search for, collect, and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records.

Thank you,

Mea Klein
Assistant City Clerk
City of Fullerton
714-738-6571

communications.subject: 19-47 Update to Earlier Email Sent Regarding an Extension
communications.communication:
Hi Rebecca,

I apologize, in reviewing your request further, it was determined that the extension notice sent was in error.

We will need clarification regarding your request for records.  You requested: "Arrest records and affidavits."  Your request is overly broad and lacking specifics.  Can you please clarify your request?

Thank you,

Mea Klein
Assistant City Clerk
City of Fullerton
714-738-6571

communications.subject: 19-47 Response to records request
communications.communication:
Rebecca,

The City is in the process of reviewing and appropriately redacting and preparing for production the records responsive to your request.  We anticipate that the records will be available no later than 5:00 p.m. on March 4, 2019. We will let you know as soon as the records are available.


Mea Klein
Assistant City Clerk
City of Fullerton
714-738-6571
